Licensed and regulated by the Labour Dep: Licensed and regulated by the Labour Department of the Hong Kong government,
Pure Care quickly bridges you and the ca: Pure Care quickly bridges you and the caregiver so that the caregiver can take care of the person you love.
Pure Care was founded on a simple belief: Pure Care was founded on a simple belief — Live better. We believe that everyone deserves a better quality of life regardless of age or health.
We have created a platform to share info: We have created a platform to share information of elderly caring, healthy exercise, appropriate training and balanced diet.
Pure Care believes that the challenges o: Pure Care believes that the challenges of taking care of those in need can be addressed with the right methods and tools.
What docs do I need to submit?: What docs do I need to submit?
Please whatsapp or email us your HKID ph: Please whatsapp or email us your HKID photo (only show first 4 digits), qualifications (see client Q2) and contract or payslip (you may hide salary figures). We would review your docs in 24 hours.

No need! Our registration is simple and: No need! Our registration is simple and easy.
When would I have an appointment?: When would I have an appointment?

How do I accept or decline an appointmen: How do I accept or decline an appointment?
Once a client selects you, we would what: Once a client selects you, we would whatsapp and email you. In the email titled “Need Your Confirmation”, please scroll to the bottom to accept or decline the appointment.
Appointment is on a first-come-first ser: Appointment is on a first-come-first serve basis.
When would I get paid after the appointm: When would I get paid after the appointment?
We would pay you within 24 hours via ban: We would pay you within 24 hours via bank transfer or 3 calendar days via cheque, assuming there are no disputes. We pay 365 days.
I have accepted the appointment but cann: I have accepted the appointment but cannot come. What should I do?
Please whatsapp or email us immediately. The client would still give you a rating and review.

Would you need another caregiver to help: Would you need another caregiver to help out ?
Please book another caregiver if so !: Please book another caregiver if so !

2) Consultation Letter 3) Consultation F: 2) Consultation Letter 3) Consultation Fee 4) Taxi Fare for both ways.

Why should I use Pure Care?: Why should I use Pure Care?
Pure Care is the first online caregiver: Pure Care is the first online caregiver platform and are licensed by the Labour Department in Hong Kong.
We provide authentic caregiver informati: We provide authentic caregiver information and are impartial when it comes to displaying caregivers.
all caregiver information, including qu: all caregiver information, including qualifications and work experience, on our platform is verified.
you see full background of caregivers wi: you see full background of caregivers with verified ratings and feedback.
appointment can be confirmed as quickly: appointment can be confirmed as quickly as 2 hours.
How do I know qualifications, work exper: How do I know qualifications, work experience and ratings are all authentic on Pure Care?
Before their profiles are on Pure Care,: Before their profiles are on Pure Care, we screen and vet all caregivers qualifications and work experience, employment contracts or payslips and licence (if any).
Only clients who appoint the caregiver c: Only clients who appoint the caregiver can provide ratings and feedback.
All caregivers on our platform must poss: All caregivers on our platform must possess the following qualification(s):
- A Certificate of Registration (Part I): - A Certificate of Registration (Part I) (Registered Nurse)
- A Certificate of Enrolment (Part I) (E: - A Certificate of Enrolment (Part I) (Enrolled Nurse)
- A valid Practising Certificate issued: - A valid Practising Certificate issued by the Nursing Council of Hong Kong.
- Health Worker Training Courses approve: - Health Worker Training Courses approved by the Director of Social Welfare
- Hold ‘Personal Care Worker’ or other r: - Hold ‘Personal Care Worker’ or other relevant certificates by an accredited institution in Hong Kong
- Hold ‘Out-Patient Escort’ or other rel: - Hold ‘Out-Patient Escort’ or other relevant by an accredited institution in Hong Kong
If they have first-aid, Occupational The: If they have first-aid, Occupational Therapy or Physiotherapy Assistant Certificates, these would be shown in the education section.
Can I ask the caregiver to do housework: Can I ask the caregiver to do housework or cook?
For housework, this is not recommended s: For housework, this is not recommended so that the care receiver can receive 1-to-1 personal service.
For cooking, the caregiver would be happ: For cooking, the caregiver would be happy to reheat or make simple diets such as pureed diet.
Can I select a male caregiver?: Can I select a male caregiver?
Of course! The gender ( ♂ or ♀) is displ: Of course! The gender ( ♂ or ♀) is displayed in the caregiver profile.
Can the caregiver provide care that is o: Can the caregiver provide care that is out of the service scope?
You may fill in requests in ‘Is there an: You may fill in requests in ‘Is there anything that you would like the caregiver to know?’. You should, however, be mindful that only Registered or Enrolled Nurses can provide all services under special care.
Please do not ask caregivers to provide: Please do not ask caregivers to provide medical care that are not within their capabilities (e.g. asking health worker to change nasogastric / gastrostomy tube), as this would put the patient and the caregiver in unnecessary risks.

The client understands that Pure Care re: The client understands that Pure Care reserves the right to terminate the client’s access from the platform and/or forfeits Pure Care Service Fees without prior notice if Pure Care or the caregiver suspect that any of the personal information is falsified.
The client understands that Pure Care ma: The client understands that Pure Care may disclose the client’s personal data or any part thereof to: -
(i) Any caregivers selected by the clien: (i) Any caregivers selected by the client to provide the service;
(ii) Any third-party services providers: (ii)  Any third-party services providers who provide administrative, telecommunications, computer, or other services to Pure Care;
(iii) Any person by whom Pure Care is r: (iii)  Any person by whom Pure Care is required by applicable legal, governmental or regulatory requirements to make disclosure;
(iv) Any other person reasonably requiri: (iv) Any other person reasonably requiring the same in order for Pure Care to connect the client with the caregiver
The client expressly consents to being c: The client expressly consents to being contacted by Pure Care via phone, email, WhatsApp, SMS massaging, or any other reasonable means, at any of the contact numbers or addresses, in order that Pure Care may perform its role of connecting the client with the caregiver. For more information on use of information, please refer to Pure Care’s Privacy Policy.
(a) The fees are comprised as follows:: (a) The fees are comprised as follows:
1. Caregiver Charges: Caregiver Charges: 1. Caregiver Charges: Caregiver Charges Per Hour x Service Duration
2. Pure Care Service Fee: 0 to 20% in ad: 2. Pure Care Service Fee: 0 to 20% in addition to Caregiver Charges
3. Transport Fee: HK$150 if the service: 3. Transport Fee: HK$150 if the service starts or finishes at midnight or before 6:30am (Excluded from Pure Care Service Fee)
3. Transport Fee: HK$150 if the service starts or finishes at midnight or before 6:30pm (Excluded from Pure Care Service Fee)
4. Transport Subsidy: Optional amount gi: 4. Transport Subsidy: Optional amount given by the client (Excluded from Pure Care Service Fee)
(b) The client is responsible for all fe: (b) The client is responsible for all fees incurred under the account. Appointment is not reserved until the client completes the payment successfully and receives a confirmation email from Pure Care.
(c) Pure Care reserves the right to term: (c) Pure Care reserves the right to terminate this service agreement or suspend its services, but termination of this service agreement would not prejudice the rights and/or claims by Pure Care against the client and does not exempt the client from fulfilling the obligations, including payment of all outstanding fees:
(i) where any fees or payments become ov: (i) where any fees or payments become overdue;
(ii) where the client breaches any of th: (ii) where the client breaches any of the terms of this service agreement;
(iii) any information stated by the clie: (iii) any information stated by the client is found to be untrue or misleading.
The client understands that the client w: The client understands that the client would have to book an appointment for the service through the platform and have to pay the fees in advance.
By booking an appointment, the client su: By booking an appointment, the client submits an offer to the caregiver for the service. Pure Care or the caregiver expressly reserve the right to decline the appointment. Pure Care also does not guarantee that the caregiver will be punctual, or will attend any appointment.
The Caregiver is eligible for a 30-min m: The Caregiver is eligible for a 30-min meal for 8 hours and a 60-min meal for 12 hours of the service. The meal is prepared by the caregiver but eating the meal is counted in the service time.
5. Prohibition of Direct/Indirect Engage: 5. Prohibition of Direct/Indirect Engagement by Caregiver
I acknowledge and fully understand that: I acknowledge and fully understand that after my registration with Pure Care, written consent must be obtained from Pure Care before giving any offer(s) to, and/or engage (regardless of whether exists any employment relationship), directly or indirectly, with any Pure Care’s caregivers (regardless of whether caregivers are acting for themselves or acting for and on behalf of other companies or organisations, including its affiliated companies or agents) introduced to me by Pure Care, in connection with provision of the service or work in similar nature. Otherwise I shall be liable for all losses and/or damages and/or administrative costs suffered by Pure Care.
This prohibition shall subsist or shall: This prohibition shall subsist or shall be valid at all times until the expiry of half year from the caregiver’s last day of work with the client introduced by Pure Care.
The service will be suspended during typ: The service will be suspended during typhoon number 8 or above or black rainstorm. Please reschedule the service with the caregiver. Pure Care would pay the caregiver after the client informs us the new date and time and the caregiver completes the service.
(a) If the client intends to cancel the: (a) If the client intends to cancel the service before payment, the client may do so. However, if the client would not be able to cancel the service after payment.

(a) any of the client’s injury or death: (a) any of the client’s injury or death because of the provision of the service; or
(b) any loss of or damage to any of the: (b) any loss of or damage to any of the client’s property
Pure Care does not assume responsibility: Pure Care does not assume responsibility or liability for any ratings and reviews on the platform.

Additionally, Pure Care reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to immediately remove the client’s profile from the platform without remorse and prior notice and to initiate without notice appropriate legal actions or proceedings to seek appropriate remedies and/or damages, including but not limited to lost revenue, repairs, legal fees, costs and expenses, and to seek injunctions or other equitable remedies, for the client’s misuse or suspected misuse of the platform.

The client undertakes not to misuse or attempt to misuse or circumvent the platform, or uses the platform for any unlawful, immoral, inappropriate or non-personal purposes, including but not limited to activities such as hacking, scraping content, infiltrating, fraud, advertising, jamming or spamming. From patients with early signs of dement: From patients with early signs of dementia to patients in more progressive stages, there are drug and non- drug therapies that may alleviate some of their symptoms. If patients are taken care of well, their progression of dementia can be slowed down.
Our caregivers are here to provide scare: Our caregivers are here to provide scare to patients with dementia so that they would feel safe, secure and comfortable.
Accompany to Walk Around / Do Mild Exerc: Accompany to Walk Around / Do Mild Exercise

Which type of caregivers should I choose: Which type of caregivers should I choose?
(for patients who only need being accomp: (for patients who only need being accompanied to work around / do mild exercise/ fed/ cut nails)
we verify all caregivers including certi: we verify all caregivers including certificates and work experience before they are on our platform.
By clicking just a few buttons, they wou: By clicking just a few buttons, they would visit the care receiver’s home and provide the services needed with the knowledge of the care receiver’s medical background.
The major goal in treating diabetes is t: The major goal in treating diabetes is to control blood sugar levels so that they are within the normal rage. Diabetes is treated with insulin or non-insulin medications, exercise and dietary changes.
Our caregivers can assist in managing th: Our caregivers can assist in managing the diabetes in order to control blood sugar levels.
Measure Weight / Blood Pressure / Body T: Measure Weight / Blood Pressure / Body Temperature
Mentally challenged patients require int: Mentally challenged patients require intensive care and efforts. Indeed, taking care of them are often physically demanding. Our caregivers can alleviate your workload to assist them from walking around to taking care of the wound.
Palliative care makes you as comfortable: Palliative care makes you as comfortable as possible by managing your pain and other distressing symptoms.
From heart failure to cancer patients, o: From heart failure to cancer patients, our caregivers will walk you through every stage of treatment and provide medical and emotional support to you and the family.
Post surgery is often about wound care a: Post surgery is often about wound care and pain management. Apart from following doctor’s instruction, healing quickly requires hard work and adequate care of others around the patient.
Our caregivers are to help in every step: Our caregivers are to help in every step of the way from accompanying the patient to see doctor to cleaning the wound.
After stroke, it is vital to provide on-: After stroke, it is vital to provide on-going support to the patient to help them in the recovery process. The care focuses on assisting daily activities, providing medical care and offering emotional and speech therapy. If we manage the recovery process well, the patient can regain a significant level of functional activities.
Regardless of whether the patient has st: Regardless of whether the patient has stroke first or several times, is functional or bed-bound or has complications, our caregivers are to listen, help and support.
PEG Feeding / Gauze and Tape Dressing: PEG Feeding / Gauze and Tape Dressing
Infection prevention, further damage min: Infection prevention, further damage minimization and wound caring are the 3 main aspects in wound care.
The patient would experience symptoms su: The patient would experience symptoms such as pain, swelling, redness, infection or fever. Our caregivers will apply strict measures in wound dressing, change patient position regularly where necessary and avoid excessive pressure and friction on the wound.
We know some medical terms may be confus: We know some medical terms may be confusing. Don’t worry, let us walk you through and explain what they mean.
A form of fat produced in the body.
People with heart disease and / or diabe: People with heart disease and / or diabetes are often found with high levels of triglyceride.
Overweight or obese, lack of exercise, s: Overweight or obese, lack of exercise, smoking, excessive drinking, and carbohydrate accounts for a very high proportion in diets (60% or above of total calories).
The Nethersole School of Nursing, Chines: The Nethersole School of Nursing, Chinese University of Hong Kong
After removing parts of the colon or rec: After removing parts of the colon or rectum from surgery, stoma is an artificial opening created to release fasces or urine from the intestine or urethra.
Given that the patient cannot control ex: Given that the patient cannot control excretion, it is necessary to place an ostomy bag on the stoma in order to collect excretion.
Commonly in patients with colorectal can: Commonly in patients with colorectal cancer.
Common in patients who have a malignant: Common in patients who have a malignant tumor in rectum or anus; the rectum, anus, and sphincter have to be removed as a result.
Tube filled with liquid diet to provide: Tube filled with liquid diet to provide calories, nutrition and medicine to the patient.
Commonly used in patients with stroke an: Commonly used in patients with stroke and nasopharyngeal cancer.
Unable to eat or have swallow difficulti: Unable to eat or have swallow difficulties or have specific gastrointestinal disorders.
A gastrostomy is a procedure to create a: A gastrostomy is a procedure to create an artificial stoma on the stomach and abdominal wall, allowing the gastrostomy tube to be inserted directly into the stomach through the abdominal wall. The tube can then transport fluid directly to the stomach through nose and gullet.
An ulcerated area of skin over bony prom: An ulcerated area of skin over bony prominences.
Chronically ill and bedridden. Urinary o: Chronically ill and bedridden. Urinary or faecal incontinent. Overweight or underweight
Parts of the body are under continuous p: Parts of the body are under continuous pressure, blood supply to that area is hindered and a pressure sore develop as a consequence.
Provide extra oxygen to reduce heart loa: Provide extra oxygen to reduce heart load. It reduces discomfort and out of breadth caused by lack of oxygen, thereby helping to improve mobility, reduce number of hospital admission, and live longer.
Commonly for patients with chronic obstr: Commonly for patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
Memory Training / Cognitive Training / B: Memory Training / Cognitive Training / Behavourial Therapy
Memory training: Activities such as reca: Memory training: Activities such as recall and recitation to improve memory.
Cognitive training: Activities such as r: Cognitive training: Activities such as reading newspapers and playing games to improve concentration, memory and problem solving skills.
Behavourial Therapy: Activities such as: Behavourial Therapy: Activities such as understanding the causes of negative thoughts and providing positive comments to help people with depression.
Commonly used with patients with brain d: Commonly used with patients with brain degeneration (such as Alzheimer’s disease) and depression.
The Hong Kong Council of Social Service: The Hong Kong Council of Social Service
Insert the catheter into the bladder to: Insert the catheter into the bladder to allow urine to flow into the urine bag.
Commonly used for patients with urinary: Commonly used for patients with urinary incontinence, spinal injuries and lower paralysis.
